official-title.#text:
Honoring the life of the Honorable Larcenia
		  J. Bullard.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
mourns the loss of Senator, mother, wife,
			 and friend Larcenia J. Bullard;

sends its deepest
			 condolences and sympathies to the Bullard family;

pays tribute to
			 Senator Bullard’s life and legacy; and

commends the
			 Bullard family for their service to the South Florida community and the Nation.

Whereas former Florida State Senator Larcenia J. Bullard
			 passed away on March 16, 2013;

Whereas Senator Bullard was a strong advocate for her
			 constituents, representing the families of South Florida with passion and
			 integrity, standing up for the issues that she believed in and offering
			 inspiration to many;

Whereas Senator Bullard’s legislative accomplishments
			 include the passage of the Good Samaritan Act, which strengthened protections
			 for people who give reasonable assistance to others during an emergency, the
			 State Facilities/Emergency Shelters Act, which authorized usage of additional
			 State facilities as emergency shelters, and the Official State Pie Act, which
			 designated the Key Lime Pie as the official pie of the State of Florida;

Whereas Senator Bullard worked like a Trojan to help
			 rebuild South Miami-Dade County following Hurricane Andrew;

Whereas Senator Bullard made public service a tradition in
			 her family;

Whereas it is of historical significance that Senator
			 Bullard’s husband, Edward, succeeded her in the House in 2000, and their son,
			 Dwight, succeeded his father in the House in 2008 and his mother in the Senate
			 in 2012; and

Whereas Senator Bullard is survived by her husband and
			 former State Representative Edward Bullard, son State Senator Dwight Bullard,
			 son Vincent Brooker, daughter Edwina Bullard Simms, and grandchildren Myles
			 Brooker, Vinicia Brooker, Mylicia Brooker, and Gavin Ethan Simms: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 139 IH: Honoring the life of the Honorable Larcenia J. Bullard.
